Articles.Content:
hello guys

im new to ksp and ive a question bout the orbital lines which appear while adding and adjusting a maneuver point.

these lines are nearly invisible because they are faded  out too much.

how can I adjust these fading in the game settings? in a video i saw that they can be doted lines without any fading. that would be the setting I prefer.

ur help is much appreciated.

 

cheers saro

Many people prefer the orbit line fade to be reversed so that the faintest part is where you've just been. Adjusting that is a matter of ticking the box in the settings menu on the title screen in the graphics tab. You can also adjust the fade amount with the slider.
Specifically, Reactordrone means the main settings screen -- the one you get to my exiting to the Main Menu, then hitting Back once.

hey guys,

thanks for your answers. Sadley they didnt help. I think I ve to be more precise with my question...

My problem is not the adjustment of the main orbital lines. what I cant adjust are the predicted course lines when you adjust a maneuver node.

This is the behavior I d like to have:

As you can see here the lines are dotted and have no alpha blending.

 

At my PC these maneuver lines are not dotted and they are faded out too much so I cant see them nearly.

As Im at work now I cant post a screenshot of the behavior of such lines at my PC but it is weird because I cant find any picture in the internet which shows that. Im nearly thinkinking its a bug.

If anyone has a solution that would be fantastic.
